intro: Dichaea, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and fascinating epiphytic plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, often translucent leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, deriving moisture and nutrients from the air rather than soil. Dichaea species are known for their small, delicate flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, or purple. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, many Dichaea species are now considered endangered.
